description.narrative: The Confederacion Nacional de Mujeres Indigenas de Bolivia will work to raise awareness of indigenous women throughout lowlands (Chaco and the Amazon) affected by the socio environmental issues in their territories from petroleum mega projects. It will provide information to indigenous communities about their rights and how to face the negative impacts of the projects. In Bolivia, the extractive industry is threatening the environment, organizational structures, traditional modes of life and production, food security and sovereignty, and natural biodiversity. Specifically, it will work to strengthen the capacity of indigenous women to exercise their rights with 4 capacity workshops and 4 experience exchanges between female leaders and other indigenous communities.
